title: 'War cabinet' response needed for drought
text:
Labor has called on Prime Minister Scott Morrison to rally a "war cabinet" to deal with the historic drought, harking back to World War II era bipartisanship.

After 11 Liberal and Nationals MPs used the Coalition partyroom meeting in Canberra to raise concerns about the government's drought response this week, Opposition Leader Anthony Albanese said helping farmers and struggling communities should be above politics.

Mr Albanese was asked if he supported calls from Labor colleague Joel Fitzgibbon for a "war cabinet" approach.



"I certainly would welcome participation in a bipartisan way in dealing with the trauma which people in regional Australia and our farmers are suffering from," Mr Albanese said on Wednesday.

Senior government and opposition members cooperated in cabinet decision-making during World War II, putting aside party disputes in the national interest.

"It's a practical suggestion and the government doesn't seem to have been able to come up with a strategy itself, so this is a practical way forward which we have suggested."
description: Labor has called on Prime Minister Scott Morrison to rally a 'war cabinet' to deal with the historic drought, harking back to World War II bipartisanship.
